sentences.sContent: a judgment reflecting the decency and good sense of the American people
sentences.sCn: 反映美国人民正直和智慧的判断

sentences.sContent: Is there no sense of decency left in this country?
sentences.sCn: 这个国家的道德观难道已经泯灭了吗？

sentences.sContent: If they’re going to charge people a fee, they ought to at least have the decency to tell them in advance.
sentences.sCn: 如果他们要对人们收费，至少也应该事先告诉一声。

synos.tran: 正派；体面；庄重；合乎礼仪；礼貌

remMethod.val: 来自decent(adj. 正派的， 端庄的)

words.tran: 正派的；得体的；相当好的
合适地；高雅地；正派地；亲切地

trans.tranCn: 得体；宽容，大方；正派，合乎礼仪，体面；
trans.tranOther: polite, honest, and moral behaviour and attitudes that show respect for other people
